title: Improve Event Listeners for Instance Classes
body:
On current versions instances do have a callback for selected, deselected and changed. However these are provided on the instance constructor and passed by over with the `CanvasMouseCtx` class

```
export type CanvasMouseCtx ={
  mouse_position: MousePosition
  canvas_element_ctx:  any
  instance_context: any
  trigger_instance_changed: () => void,
  instance_selected: () => void,
  instance_deselected: () => void,
  new_global_instance: () => Instance,
  mouse_down_delta_event: MousePosition,
  mouse_down_position: MousePosition,
  label_settings: any
}
```

The type itself is very helpful, but we can further improve this by removing the function attributes of the listener to the type and pass them in a separate objects or dynamically by doing function to set/unset listeners.

The task on this will be:

1. Remove the listeners from the constructor classes of the instances
2. Add functions to add callbacks on event: `instance.on('selected', callback)`
3. Refactor `CanvasMouseCtx` and the `initialize_instance_object()` function to better handle callbacks and event listeners.
